document.masterDocTitle: Polychaetes from Santa Catarina State (southern Brazil): checklist and remarks on species distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Polychaetes from Santa Catarina State (southern Brazil): checklist and remarks on species distribution

subSubSection.paragraph: References: Souza (2004, 2008), Netto et al. ( 2007 ), Vivan et al. ( 2009 ), Domingos ( 2010 ), Almeida & Vivan

as Prionospio dayi

subSubSection.paragraph: Environment: Bay, estuarine beach, coastal lagoon, inner continental shelf

Species:
Dipolydora socialis (Schmarda 1861 )
References: Netto & Gallucci ( 2003 ) as
Polydora socialis .
Environment: Mangrove

Species:
Dispio remanei Friedrich 1956
References: Amaral & Morgado ( 1998 ), Souza ( 2008 ), Almeida et al. ( 2012 ) Environment: Bay, estuarine beach, inner continental shelf Depth: 1–12 m
Note: Specimens from the type locality are needed to elucidate the taxonomical position of this species. This
taxon seems to be endemic to the studied area.

Species:
Laonice aperata Radashevsky & Lana 2009
References: Radashevsky & Lana ( 2009 )
Environment: Middle continental shelf, continental slope Depth: 38–225 m

Species:
Laonice branchiata Nonato, Bolivar & Lana 1986
Environment: Bay, estuarine beach, inner continental shelf, middle continental shelf

Species:
Laonice parvabranchiata Radashevsky & Lana 2009
References: Radashevsky & Lana ( 2009 ) Environment: Continental slope

& Vivan ( 2011 ), Almeida et al. ( 2012 ) as
Laonice cirrata
.
Environment: Bay, inner continental shelf, continental slope

Note: The material previously referred to
L. cirrata
is either
L. branchiata
or
L. petersenae Radashevsky and

Species:
Laonice weddellia Hartman 1978
References: Radashevsky & Lana ( 2009 )
Environment: Bay, coastal lagoon, tidal flat, salt marsh, inner continental shelf, middle continental shelf, outer

Species:
Polydora cf. haswelli Blake & Kudenov 1978
Environment: Bay, coastal lagoon, mangrove, creek, tidal flat
Note: This material needs to be revised, due to some consistent differences with the original description.

Species:
Prionospio cf. cirrifera Wirén 1883
References: Rohr & Almeida ( 2006 )
Note: This material needs to be revised, due to some consistent differences with the original description.

Species:
Prionospio heterobranchia Moore 1907
References: Silva ( 2004 ), Pagliosa ( 2005 ), Souza ( 2008 ) Environment: Bay, coastal lagoon

Vivan ( 2011 ), Almeida et al. ( 2012 ) as
Prionospio steenstrupi
.
Environment: Bay, coastal lagoon, inner continental shelf, middle continental shelf, continental slope
Note: This material needs to be revised. It is probably a new species.
Environment: Bay, sand beach, estuarine beach

Species:
Spio (Microspio) gaucha Orensanz & Gianuca 1974
References: Amaral & Morgado ( 1998 ) Environment: Beach

Species:
Spiophanes anoculata Hartman 1960
References: Blankensteyn et al. ( 2003 ), Almeida et al . ( 2012 ) as
Spiophanes bombix .
Environment: Inner continental shelf

References: Attolini ( 2002 ), Souza ( 2008 ) as
Spiophanes kroeyri .
Environment: Bay, outer continental shelf, continental slope
Note: This material needs to be revised, due to some consistent differences with the original description.

References: Bolivar & Lana ( 1988 ), Blankensteyn et al. ( 2003 ) as
Spiophanes missionensis
.
Environment: Inner continental shelf, middle continental shelf, outer continental shelf
